episodes.original_body:
Case: Michael-Lanier-MVA-6-28-2025
Client: Michael Lanier

FILE REORGANIZATION COMPLETE - Michael Lanier MVA Case: Completed comprehensive 5-phase file reorganization using 8-bucket directory system. Phase 1: Generated inventory of 15 files with content-only analysis (filenames scrambled to eliminate bias). Phase 2: Single sub-agent analyzed all 6 scrambled .md files with content-based categorization. Phase 3: Quality review achieved 0.0% error rate (perfect accuracy - 0 errors out of 6 files). Phase 4: Successfully executed 7 operations (4 moves with PDF reunification, 3 deletes) with zero errors. Phase 5: Verified 100% naming convention compliance and PDF+MD companion file integrity. Results: Medical Records/Allstar Chiropractic organized into 3 subfolders - Medical Bills (1 PDF+MD pair: Account Ledger dated 7/16/2025 showing $1,635.00 total charges), Medical Records (1 PDF+MD pair: Chart Notes for multiple visits 7/16-8/13/2025), Medical Requests (2 PDF+MD pairs: Records Request Letter dated 10/24/2025 from WLF to Allstar Chiropractic, HIPAA Authorization signed 10/24/2025). Deleted 2 duplicate files (duplicate ledger and chart notes) and 1 template DOCX file. Key case information: Client Michael Lanier DOB 10/08/2005, accident date 6/28/2025, treated for cervical/lumbar complaints and headaches, 6 chiropractic visits from 7/16/2025-8/13/2025 at Allstar Chiropractic (7201 Dixie Hwy, Florence, KY), total charges $1,635.00, account #224847-PI. Insurance: State Farm PIP (Policy 17-87C986K), Progressive BI (Claim 25-471551085). Child case under parent project The-Laniers-MVA-8-28-2025. Case phase changed to Demand in Progress on 10/24/2025. All files properly organized with standardized naming conventions. Case ready for demand preparation. All reorganization reports saved to Reports/ directory.
episodes.natural_language:
Case: Michael-Lanier-MVA-6-28-2025. Client: Michael Lanier.

A five-phase file reorganization for the Michael Lanier MVA case was completed using an eight-bucket directory system. Phase 1 generated an inventory of 15 files with content-only analysis, and the filenames were scrambled to eliminate bias. Phase 2 had a single sub-agent analyze all 6 scrambled .md files with content-based categorization. Phase 3 achieved a quality review with a 0.0% error rate (perfect accuracy—0 errors out of 6 files). Phase 4 successfully executed 7 operations (4 moves with PDF reunification and 3 deletes) with zero errors. Phase 5 verified 100% naming convention compliance and PDF+MD companion file integrity. All results were saved in the Reports/ directory.

The reorganization produced a structured result for Medical Records/Allstar Chiropractic organized into 3 subfolders: Medical Bills contains 1 PDF+MD pair—the Account Ledger dated 7/16/2025 showing $1,635.00 total charges; Medical Records contains 1 PDF+MD pair—the Chart Notes for multiple visits dated 7/16/2025 to 8/13/2025; Medical Requests contains 2 PDF+MD pairs—the Records Request Letter dated 10/24/2025 from WLF to Allstar Chiropractic and the HIPAA Authorization signed 10/24/2025. In the process, 2 duplicate files were deleted (the duplicate ledger and the chart notes) and 1 template DOCX file was removed.

Key case information: Client Michael Lanier, DOB 10/08/2005, was in an accident on 6/28/2025 and treated for cervical/lumbar complaints and headaches, with 6 chiropractic visits from 7/16/2025 to 8/13/2025 at Allstar Chiropractic, located at 7201 Dixie Hwy, Florence, KY. Total charges were $1,635.00, account #224847-PI. Insurance coverage includes State Farm PIP (Policy 17-87C986K) and Progressive BI (Claim 25-471551085). This is a child case under the parent project The-Laniers-MVA-8-28-2025. The case phase was changed to Demand in Progress on 10/24/2025. All files are properly organized with standardized naming conventions, and the case is ready for demand preparation. All reorganization reports have been saved to the Reports/ directory.
episodes.author: Roscoe (AI Paralegal)
